channel.title: Transfering data to new HDD
channel.description:
What would be the best method of transferring my photos and videos (and a few other things) over to the new one? I'm planning on just tossing the old one.
If I install it into the case, should I install the OS on it, then try dragging and dropping my files from one HD to the other?
I need some guidance :P

item.title: Transfering data to new HDD
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

Acronis True Image 11, amazing as fk. Imaged my entire drive no problem at all. (ilya’s idea is fail).

Read full topic

item.title: Transfering data to new HDD
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Wat?
I did it before just by putting the hard drive into my computer, downloading the drivers for it then it automatically showed the two hard drives.

:S

Read full topic

item.title: Transfering data to new HDD
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

Install the OS, and then try drag-and-dropping (just dont overwrite the WINDOWS shit!)

Read full topic

item.title: Transfering data to new HDD
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

The programs usually are for cloning hard drives, and I only want a few folders (still around 50 GB though).

I’m just wondering if it works like that. Would I be able to see the new drive under ‘My computer’, and be able to drop stuff into it?
I don’t think RAID is necessary, because I don’t want to keep the old Hd. But I could be wrong…

Read full topic

item.title: Transfering data to new HDD
item.dc:creator: @nator123123 nator123123
item.description:
@nator123123 wrote:

Gawd damnit, I had a program that does it, I don’t remember it.
